intro: Cynoglossum montbretii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. It is a perennial species that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Cynoglossum montbretii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to cold climates.
